thread.title: Soccer: Mata carries Man U to victory - Soccer
thread.title_full: Soccer: Mata carries Man U to victory - Soccer - NorthJersey.com

author: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS |
title: Soccer: Mata carries Man U to victory - Soccer
text:
Juan Mata scored one goal and set up another as Manchester United came from behind to beat Wolfsburg, 2-1, Wednesday for its first win in Group B of the Champions League in Manchester, England.
Daniel Caligiuri put Wolfsburg ahead after four minutes, but Mata converted a penalty to equalize the score before halftime.
In the second half, Mata back-heeled a pass straight into the path of Chris Smalling, who slotted the ball past Diego Benaglio to seal the three points in the 53rd minute. 
MANCHESTER CITY 2, MOENCHENGLADBACH 1 (at Moenchengladbach, Germany) — Sergio Aguero scored a last-minute penalty as the English side got the first win of its Champions League campaign.
Aguero was fouled by American defender Fabian Johnson in the 89th minute and sent 'Gladbach keeper Yann Sommer the wrong way for the win. 
Lars Stindl opened the scoring in the 54th for the home side, which was playing European Cup football at home for the first time in 37 years.
REAL MADRID 2, MALMO 0 (at Malmo, Sweden) — Cristiano Ronaldo scored the 500th and 501st goals of his career in the win over 10-man Malmo in Group A.
Malmo held off Madrid for nearly a half-hour before it was caught off guard by a counterattack as Ronaldo gathered Francisco Alarcon's pass and beat goalkeeper Johan Wiland.
Ronaldo got his second goal of the night in the 90th minute, when he tapped in a pass from Lucas Vazquez in front of the goal. It was his 323rd goal for Madrid, equaling Raul's scoring record for the club.
PSG 3, SHAKHTAR 0 (at Lviv, Ukraine) — Paris Saint-Germain defender Serge Aurier had a dream Champions League debut, scoring one goal and setting up another.
JUVENTUS 2, SEVILLA 0 (at Turin, Italy) — Juventus moved to the top of Group D in the Champions League.
Alvaro Morata broke the deadlock with four minutes left in the half, scoring for the fifth successive league match.
